sessions.title: Panel Discussion: Cloud Native Strategies for Digital Business, Speed and Automation
sessions.description:
This panel discussion explores the transformative power of cloud-native strategies in driving digital business success. Experts will delve into how adopting cloud-native approaches accelerates development cycles, enhances scalability, and fosters innovation. Key topics include leveraging microservices, containers, and serverless architectures to optimize performance and reduce time-to-market. The discussion will also highlight automation tools and practices that streamline operations, improve efficiency, and support continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD). Attendees will gain insights into best practices and real-world applications, empowering them to navigate the complexities of digital transformation with agility and precision.

Panelists —

Dawid van der Merwe, Solutions Architect at SUSE.
Avinash Meetoo, Director at Knowledge7
Dr. Viv Padayatchy, Managing Director, Cybernaptics Ltd

sessions.title: Introduction to Machine Learning Engineering for Production (MLOps)
sessions.description:
Gain an overview of the machine learning operations (MLOps) life cycle, processes, and capabilities. Understand concrete details about running a continuous training pipeline, deploying a model, and monitoring predictive performance of ML models.

In this session, you will learn:

-The MLOps life cycle and important processes and capabilities for successful ML-based systems
-Orchestrating and automating the execution of continuous training pipelines
-Model deployment and prediction serving
-Dataset and feature management
-Model management and governance

Join me for an insightful exploration into building ML-enabled systems, gaining a holistic understanding of the MLOps lifecycle.

sessions.title: Clojure programming language & ecosystem  Language of the Future
sessions.description: An introductory talk about Clojure programming language and ecosystem followed by a demo of an application demonstrating the power of the language.

sessions.title: Kickstart Your Cloud Journey by conquering the AWS Cloud Resume Challenge
sessions.description:
The AWS Cloud Resume Challenge is an engaging and practical learning experience for students and young professionals to get their first hand-on experience into cloud computing. 

It will guide the audience in deploying their own professional resume as a static HTML/CSS website using AWS S3, ensure its security with HTTPS, and add dynamic functionalities like a visitor counter using Lambda and DynamoDB. Furthermore, the challenge will introduce backend development with Python, infrastructure as code, and the automation processes with CI/CD practices.

Ideal for beginners or those seeking to solidify their cloud knowledge, the AWS Cloud Resume Challenge provides a comprehensive platform to learn, apply, and showcase cloud computing skills, preparing the audience for a successful career in the tech industry.

sessions.title: How I use Obsidian as a programmer, problem solver, writer, tech enthusiast, podcast editor
sessions.description:
Discover the ultimate productivity hack for programmers, writers, and tech enthusiasts alike with Obsidian - your one-stop solution for organizing thoughts, boosting creativity, and streamlining workflows!

You can use Obsidian:
- as a work journal
- second brain
- craft compelling stories
- draft your thoughts
- integrate with AI Tools
- as a TODO List
- personal wiki
- programming notes
- draw diagrams with Excalidraw
- Kanban boards
- Slides show

All for free.

But you know what's best, you have hundreds of free and open-source extensions that boost your productivity.

sessions.title: Workflow automation using Camunda
sessions.description:
This session is perfect for developers, architects, and tech enthusiasts seeking practical insights into Camunda's workflow automation capabilities. Join us for an engaging presentation that promises to elevate your understanding and application of Camunda in real-world scenarios.


Camunda Architecture Exploration: Understand the core components and functionalities of Camunda's architecture.

Live Demos: Witness real-time demonstrations showcasing Camunda's efficient process modelling.

Microservices Integration: Explore strategies for seamlessly integrating Camunda into microservices architectures.

Dynamic Workflows: Learn how Camunda adapts to changing business requirements, creating flexible and adaptive workflows.

sessions.title: What's up AWS?
sessions.description: What's up AWS? takes a look at the latest technologies released by AWS as well as features that have been added to complement existing services.

sessions.title: Leveraging Generative AI in Mobile Applications
sessions.description: Join me as I delve into the cutting-edge world of Generative AI and its application in mobile development. This session will guide you through the practical aspects of incorporating AI technologies into mobile apps, with a special focus on Flutter. Learn how to design and implement AI-driven chatbots and enhance user interactions in real-world scenarios. Whether you’re looking to stay ahead in the industry or simply interested in the potential of AI in mobile apps, this talk will provide valuable insights and actionable strategies.

sessions.title: Shift Left approach at iQera
sessions.description:
Shift Left is not a new concept. Various companies adopt different ways of implementing shift left. The talk will discuss how we are adopting a shift left approach at iQera. 
We will discuss 2 examples where we have started using shift left approaches and we will share some statistics on the quality of the products.
We will also share how we have implemented quality gates in our CICD pipeline (including security tests)

sessions.title: An intro to Finops
sessions.description: It's an approach to cloud cost management for teams in which users accept responsibility for their cloud usage and are assisted by a central best-practices group. Cross-functional teams in engineering, finance, product, etc. collaborate to improve financial control and predictability while enabling faster product delivery.

sessions.title: Digital accessibility
sessions.description:
An introduction to digital accessibility and why it matters more and more

I'll be examining methods to enhance accessibility for individuals with disabilities. We'll delve into both regulatory requirements and optimal approaches, spanning from project inception to development, ensuring broader accessibility across websites.

I will be discussing how addressing digital accessibility from the initial stages of a website's conception through to its development can lead to better outcomes. By integrating accessibility considerations early in the project lifecycle, we ensure more effective results by the end.

I will cover how essential it is for everyone involved in a digital project to focus on accessibility. This includes designers, who need to incorporate accessibility from the conception phase, tech leads who define accessibility specifications before development begins, and developers who implement these specifications by creating accessible components. 

My presentation will focus on addressing accessibility throughout the different stages of a project. I will provide practical examples, including accessible designs, technical documentation, and development practices. Additionally, there will be live demonstrations showing how to use assistive technologies, such as navigation via keyboard and screen readers. This hands-on approach will help illustrate the importance of incorporating accessibility into every phase of our work.

sessions.title: AWS Cloudformation vs Terraform
sessions.description:
Alright, infrastructure enthusiasts, gather around! Today's session is a cloud configuration showdown: CloudFormation versus Terraform!

For those of you thinking, "Been there, done that,"  think again! We'll be uncovering the superpowers of each tool, their hidden quirks, and maybe even a serverless pun or two so bad they're hilarious.  Whether you're a CloudFormation champion or a Terraform terra-former – yes, I went there – this session is your chance to see which tool best suits your infrastructure needs. 

Buckle up and get ready to rumble in the cloud!

sessions.title: Demystifying Explainable AI (XAI): Why It Matters and How to Implement It
sessions.description: This session unveils the secrets of Explainable AI (XAI), helping you understand why AI models behave the way they do. Learn practical techniques and code examples to implement XAI in your projects, building trustworthy and transparent AI applications.

sessions.title: From Code to Command: Nurturing Leadership in Development
sessions.description:
Introduction:
In 'From Code to Command: Nurturing Leadership in Development,' drawing from my 15 years of development experience, I'll reveal how I discovered early in my career that every developer, regardless of title, has the potential to lead and contribute to the team's success.

Main Idea and Subtopics:
I will showcase projects, including high-profile clients like on-demand streaming platforms and leading automakers, demonstrating the leadership exhibited by every developer (including developers from Mauritius, Germany and beyond). From managing MVPs to overseeing system integration, these examples will highlight the pivotal role played by individual leadership in uniting the team towards a common goal.

Conclusion:
In conclusion, I'll share valuable management tools and emphasize the importance of soft skills that are crucial for leadership in every individual. 'From Code to Command' is not just about writing code; it's about fostering a culture where every developer becomes a leader, contributing to the collective success of the team.

sessions.title: Golang WebAssembly: Unlocking the Full Potential with Advanced Techniques and Applications
sessions.description:
Abstract: 
Explore advanced aspects of Golang WebAssembly development, covering topics such as memory management, asynchronous operations, DOM manipulation techniques, and seamless integration with JavaScript libraries. This session is designed to provide attendees with practical insights and skills to optimize Golang WebAssembly applications for complex scenarios.


Discussion 
In our session, we aim to explore the parallels between the developer's dilemma of reinventing the wheel and the introduction of WebAssembly (Wasm) in web development and gain valuable insights that can assist advanced developers in navigating the evolving landscape of web development.  We'll discuss about how developers, like all of us, prefer using solutions that already work instead of starting from scratch – it's like not reinventing the wheel. 

We'll relate this to WebAssembly (Wasm) in web development.. Wasm provides a faster and more versatile way of handling tasks, supporting various languages. We'll explore why some developers might be unsure about trying new methods, whether it involves adopting new patterns or embracing innovative tech like Wasm. We want to explore finding a balance between what we already know works and trying out fresh ideas to make web development simpler as well as give demonstration of Wasm with simple to real world use cases.

Key Takeaways:
-  Advanced techniques for Golang WebAssembly development.
-  Practical applications and use cases for complex scenarios.
-  In-depth insights into memory management, asynchronous operations, and DOM manipulation.
-  Demonstrations of seamlessly integrating Golang with JavaScript libraries.

sessions.title: Navigating the Web Accessibility Landscape
sessions.description:
As we embark on the enriching journey of web accessibility, let's confront a pressing challenge – the prevailing lack of awareness and concern for individuals with disabilities. In an era where technology is the bridge to connect people globally, it's imperative to ensure this bridge is accessible to everyone, regardless of their abilities.

Addressing the Challenge:

1. Limited Understanding:
   - Many remain unaware of the challenges faced by people with disabilities in navigating digital spaces.
   - Lack of understanding contributes to overlooking accessibility features.

2. Misconceptions:
   - Common misconceptions may lead to underestimating the impact of accessibility challenges.

3. Inadequate Legal Enforcement:
   - Emphasizing legal aspects underscores the importance of compliance.


Key Topics:

1. User-Centric Accessibility Strategies:
   - Learn how to conduct user testing with individuals with varying abilities to fine-tune your design for inclusivity.

2. Demystifying WCAG 2.1:
   - Break down the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 to actionable insights, ensuring your projects not only comply but genuinely prioritize accessibility.

3. Cultivating a Culture of Accessibility:
   - Discover how accessibility can be a driving force for innovation and user-centered design within your team.

4. Tools and Technologies Shaping Inclusive Design:
   - Explore the latest assistive technologies, design tools, and development frameworks that empower you to create accessible digital experiences.


Let's collectively navigate the challenges, break down barriers, and shape a digital future where inclusivity leads the way in web accessibility.

sessions.title: Generative AI and Cybersecurity: Leveraging Gemini for Advanced Protection
sessions.description:
My session is focused on how use of Large Language models and Generative AI can be leveraged in the field of cybersecurity. This is a visionary that is being practiced but can be developed a lot further than this. 
In the rapidly evolving digital landscape, the threats to cybersecurity are becoming increasingly sophisticated. Traditional security measures are often insufficient to combat these emerging threats. This talk explores the transformative potential of Generative AI, with a focus on advanced language models like Gemini, in enhancing cybersecurity defenses. Generative AI models have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in generating human-like text, which can be leveraged for a variety of applications, including threat detection, incident response, and vulnerability analysis. We will delve into how these models can be integrated into cybersecurity frameworks to automate and enhance the detection of complex threats, generate synthetic data for training, and assist in real-time decision-making. Through detailed examples and case studies, we will illustrate the practical applications and benefits of using Generative AI in cybersecurity, while also addressing the associated challenges and ethical considerations.

sessions.title: Building and coding robots
sessions.description:
This talk is a hands-on introduction to hobby electronics, and how they can be controlled using ordinary code. I'll show you multiple Lego Technic sets, which you can manipulate with an Arduino and a bit of creativity. I'll even let you control a robot or two, using a web browser.

You do not need to know anything about electronic circuitry to find this talk interesting and informative.

sessions.title: Let's Build a Low-Code/No-Code Mobile App and Desktop App using Microsoft's Power Platform
sessions.description:
Exploring Microsoft's Power Platform: A Hands-On Journey from Canvas to Model-Driven Apps

In this immersive session, we invite attendees to delve into the transformative world of Microsoft's Power Platform, a pivotal force in the realm of low-code/no-code development. As we navigate through a live demonstration, participants will gain firsthand experience in swiftly crafting and deploying impactful business solutions, showcasing Microsoft's leadership in empowering developers with accelerated development capabilities.

Key Highlights of the Session:

Introduction to Microsoft's Power Platform: We will kick off with an insightful overview of the Power Platform, outlining its significance as a leading low-code/no-code solution in today's rapidly evolving technological landscape. Attendees will discover how the platform serves as a cornerstone for developers to innovate and address complex business challenges efficiently.

Live Demonstration: Creating a Canvas App: Engage in a hands-on demonstration where we will live create a Canvas App within a span of 15 minutes. This segment will highlight the intuitive design capabilities and flexibility of Canvas Apps, enabling personalized user experiences with minimal coding.

Transition to Model-Driven Apps: Continuing our exploration, we will shift gears to construct a Model-Driven App over another 15 minutes. This portion will emphasize the structured approach of Model-Driven Apps, leveraging data models and business logic to automate and streamline processes.

Interactive Q&A: Concluding with an open floor for questions and answers, this segment offers attendees the opportunity to clarify doubts, share insights, and engage in meaningful discussions on implementing Power Platform solutions in real-world scenarios.

sessions.title: Embracing the Power of Automated Testing with Ember.js
sessions.description: Join Keshav and Zafir as they explore the robust capabilities of automated testing in Ember.js. This talk will cover acceptance and full testing to complement your suite, as well as unit, component, and integration testing for behavioral validation. Learn about effective mocking techniques and discover best practices to enhance your testing strategy. Gain valuable insights to elevate your Ember.js projects with comprehensive automated testing.

sessions.title: Automated Testing in Symfony: Tools and Strategies for High-Quality Applications
sessions.description:
In the fast-paced world of web development, ensuring the quality and reliability of applications is paramount. This session delves into the crucial role of automated testing in the Symfony framework, providing attendees with a comprehensive understanding of how to implement effective testing strategies to maintain high-quality applications.

We will start by exploring the fundamentals of automated testing in the context of PHP and Symfony, emphasizing its importance in modern development workflows. Participants will gain insight into the various types of testing - including unit testing, integration testing, and functional testing - and when to apply each within a Symfony project.

The core of this session will focus on practical demonstrations and case studies, showcasing how to use popular tools like PHPUnit, Behat, and Symfony’s own testing components. We will guide attendees through setting up a testing environment, writing testable code, and creating robust test suites that cover critical aspects of Symfony applications.

Key topics to be covered include:

* PHPUnit Essentials for Symfony: Writing effective unit tests, mocking objects, and measuring code coverage.
* Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) with Behat: Implementing BDD in Symfony to create readable and maintainable test scenarios.
* Functional Testing with Symfony: Leveraging Symfony's browser kit and crawler to simulate user interactions and test application responses.
* Continuous Integration (CI) for Symfony Projects: Integrating automated testing into CI pipelines using tools like GitHub Actions or GitLab CI.
* Best Practices and Common Pitfalls: Practical advice on organizing test suites, optimizing test performance, and avoiding common mistakes in testing Symfony applications.

Attendees will leave this session equipped with the knowledge and skills to implement a robust automated testing framework in their Symfony projects. This session is designed to cater to developers of all levels, from those just starting with testing to seasoned professionals looking to refine their practices. By the end of our time together, participants will be well-prepared to elevate the quality and reliability of their Symfony applications through effective automated testing strategies.

Who Should Attend: 
This session is ideal for PHP developers, Symfony enthusiasts, and software engineers interested in enhancing their testing skills and understanding of automated testing in the Symfony ecosystem. Whether you are new to automated testing or looking to deepen your existing knowledge, this session will provide valuable insights and practical skills.

sessions.title: CSS in 2024: What’s Cool in Web and What’s Old School?
sessions.description:
This session is perfect for web developers who want to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and tools in CSS. We'll dive into new features like :has, container queries, view transitions, and scroll-driven animations, showing you how to use them to create amazing web experiences.

We’ll also take a fun look back at some older techniques. Through practical examples, you'll see exactly how to implement the new stuff and understand why some old methods are best left behind. Whether you're looking to polish your skills or just curious about what's new in CSS, this talk will give you the insights you need to keep your web designs fresh and modern!

sessions.title: You do not know about JavaScript Objects
sessions.description:
JavaScript objects are complex. Perhaps you do not know enough about JavaScript objects. Let us find that in this live coding based talk
Perhaps you do not know enough about JavaScript objects or I do not know enough about JavaScript objects.  Let us settle this debate in this talk. To start with, we will first settle debate on whether JavaScript is an Object Oriented Language or prototype based language. Since, we do not have class (yes in ECMA 6, there is a keyword class syntax introduced but that is not a real class anyway) then how objects are created? 
Answer of all above questions lie in understanding of following concepts, 
•	Different ways of JavaScript object creation
•	prototypes and prototype chain
•	this keyword 
•	__proto__
This session will simplify these truly vital and the most important topics of JavaScript language. As a starter, JavaScript is a prototype based language in which object is linked by another object, and in order to do that it creates a prototype chain. Having a good understanding of prototype is required to write real JavaScript applications or to work effectively with popular JavaScript Frameworks. 
This talk will be combination of live coding and visualization of concepts as drawing on the white board. At the end of the talk, you will have good understanding of following:
1.	Different ways of creating JavaScript objects such as:  Object Literals, Constructor invocation pattern ,Object.Create() method , and using class.
2.	About object property descriptors 
3.	Determining value of ‘this’ using different invocation patterns
4.	Breaking prototype, constructor, and __proto__
Having good understanding of above concept helps you to write better JavaScript application. 


It is one of my most popular talk among developers in India.  Does not matter where I have delivered it, It got good rating. We all just assume that we know JavaScript as a language, but most of the time, we do not. For example,  if foo is a function in JavaScript then what is output of foo.prototype.constructor.prototype.constructor.prototype.__proto__  . Give your audience opportunity to learn mystery of JavaScript through this talk. I explain it on white board like we learnt quadratic equation n school math.

sessions.title: Quantity over Quality: A Kubernetes Tale
sessions.description:
Kubernetes, since its release in 2015, has remained shrouded in mystery, relegated as this cryptic domain to the sorcerers who conversed in the bizarre language of yaml. But what if I told you that it doesn't have to be this way?

This session aims at casting some light on the massive complex framework that is Kubernetes, so that you too can shout "btw i use kubernetes" with pride. You will finally understand the technical jargon surrounding Kubernetes, as well as how each component works together seamlessly when deploying applications.

After this session, you will be well equipped to embark on a Kubernetes-related adventure of your own, be it as a developer of system administrator.

sessions.title: The chess play of software testing
sessions.description: How to make the most of your test team?

sessions.title: Building Robust and Scalable RESTful APIs with Laravel 11
sessions.description: Join me for an in-depth session on API development with Laravel, the powerful PHP framework. This presentation will guide you through setting up a Laravel API project, building RESTful APIs, and leveraging advanced features like middleware, authentication, and Eloquent ORM. Learn best practices for performance optimization, security, documentation, and testing. Perfect for developers looking to enhance their API skills with Laravel, this session promises practical insights and interactive discussions to help you build robust, scalable, and secure APIs.

sessions.title: Event driven approach:  Make your app more predictable, maintainable and easier to debug (copy)
sessions.description:
MVP, MVVM, MV* are popular architecture design patterns in Android development enabling us to develop smooth and responsive apps. Some time ago I discovered that every time I implemented MVVM, I created a poor man’s state machine. 

In this talk, we’ll see how we can make our apps more predictable, maintainable and easier to debug by integrating state machines into the presentation layer of the app architecture. 

Resources: https://github.com/BKinya/QuickTock
A sample project I implemented using Tinder’s state machine library

Happy Coding!

sessions.title: IA pour les clients et les équipes de développement
sessions.description:
L’arrivée de l’IA générative a généré beaucoup d’attentes et ouverts des possibilités inédites. Au-delà du buzz, ces outils présentent des limitent et la rentabilité des usages n’est pas toujours atteinte.

Nous partagerons avec vous nos expériences en la matière dans le domaine des interactions clients ainsi que dans le domaine du développement afin de contribuer à comprendre comment ces technologies pourront nous aider à être plus efficace dans les années qui viennent.

sessions.title: Digital Deception
sessions.description:
In this session, we will uncover the tricks of online scammers on how they use sneaky tactics like phishing emails and social engineering to fool people into giving them personal information.

We'll break down these scams, so you'll know how to spot them. From recognizing fake emails to understanding tricky messages, we'll give you the tools to stay safe online and a demo presentation on how these attacks are created. Because understanding the Art of Hacking empowers our defense. Together, let's learn how to outsmart cyber crooks and keep our digital lives secure.

Agenda:
  - Understanding phishing Attack
  - Common phishing techniques
  - Recognizing Red Flags
  - Best Practices for protection
  - Demo Presentation on Phishing simulation attacks

Extended Description:

Understanding Phishing: Introduction on the concept of phishing,  how attackers use deceptive tactics to trick individuals into revealing sensitive information or performing harmful actions.

Common Phishing Techniques: Exploration on various phishing techniques such as email spoofing, fake websites, and social engineering with real life scenarios.

Recognizing Red Flags: Recognizing key indicators of phishing attempts, including suspicious sender addresses, grammatical errors, urgent requests, and unusual URLs. Teach participants how to identify these red flags and distinguish legitimate communication from phishing scams.

Best Practices for Protection: Offer practical tips and best practices for protecting against phishing attacks. Emphasize the importance of skepticism, verifying sender identities, and avoiding clicking on links or downloading attachments from unknown sources.

Reporting Phishing Attempts: Educate users on the importance of reporting phishing attempts to the appropriate authorities or IT support teams. Provide guidance on how to report suspicious emails or incidents effectively.

Conclusion:
In conclusion, sensitization campaigns play a crucial role in enhancing cybersecurity resilience by arming individuals with the knowledge and skills needed to defend against phishing attacks. By raising awareness, promoting vigilance, and fostering a culture of security, we can collectively mitigate the risks associated with phishing and safeguard sensitive information and systems. Staying informed and proactive is the first line of defense against cyber threats.

References
Link 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XBkzBrXlle0&ab_channel=Simplilearn

Link 2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9dBGWVwMMA&t=4s&ab_channel=NetworkChuck

sessions.title: Beyond Bugs: The Overlooked Aspects of Software Testing
sessions.description:
Everyone can perform checks and report, but can everyone test?

It is essential to recognise that coding is not the sole protagonist in the Software Development Lifecycle. Testing, with meticulous scrutiny and validation, emerges as an equally consequential character. Although it can be challenging (more than people often realize), it is the guardian ensuring only reliable, secure and quality code goes live.

The goal of this session is to shift developers' perspective on software testing and quality assurance. We will talk about the various types of tests, levels of testing and how to choose the appropriate tests and tools for different projects/situations.

Audience: 
Both developers and testers who are curious enough to face their bugs.

Agenda:
* What are the differences between testing and checking?
* Where does testing fit in?
* Different flavours and levels of testing
* Project-focused test strategies


The level of complexity and ingenuity one can bring to testing rivals the thrill of development, and can be an entire career path in itself if one invests the time to master it.

sessions.title: Salesforce: For the Coders and the Non-Coders
sessions.description: Learn about the world’s #1 CRM tool and how you can use it with or without coding. This session will show you Salesforce’s features that work for any skill level. Plus, discover the different career paths you can take with Salesforce.

sessions.title: Secure your WordPress installation
sessions.description: Secure your WordPress and WooCommerce sites with confidence in my session, where I’ll highlight key vulnerabilities and how to combat them with effective tools and techniques. Learn about essential security plugins and strategies for real-time threat monitoring in WordPress.

sessions.title: Introduction to Google Analytics 4 (GA4)
sessions.description:
Google Analytics 4 (GA4) marks a significant evolution in the field of web analytics, offering advanced capabilities for understanding user behaviour and engagement across platforms. As businesses adapt to the digital landscape, GA4 provides invaluable insights to optimize performance, enhance user experiences, and drive strategic decision-making.
The presentation will be about the various facets of GA4, including its features, methodologies, and applications for businesses and digital marketers.
Attendees will learn:
•	The major differences between GA4 and Universal Analytics
•	How to configure GA4 to collect meaningful and accurate data
•	How to use the default reports and customize them to meet their needs.

sessions.title: Let's build a web app to monitor power outages in Mauritius, using Nuxt3 + TypeScript + TailwindCSS
sessions.description:
In this workshop organized by frontend.mu, Sandeep Ramgolam, Cedric Poilly, Kushul Soomaree and the frontend coders team will guide you through creating a web app using Nuxt 3 and TailwindCSS to monitor power outages in Mauritius. 

We will aim to build it from scratch and deploy it !

You are encouraged to bring your laptop and code along. At the end of the workshop you would have built your own web app that has your unique style and even deploy it on the internet.

sessions.title: Deploying a Personal Cloud with Ubuntu and OpenStack
sessions.description: Explain the concept of OpenStack, a free and open-source cloud platform. Showcase how to install OpenStack on Ubuntu for setting up a personal cloud environment for experimentation and learning cloud technologies.

sessions.title: Control-M - a managed File transfer solution
sessions.description: The session will give an introduction of what is Control - M, its capabilities and how it has been implemented and being used at Mauritius commercial Bank.

sessions.title: Is your website safe? — Exploring vulnerabilities on live websites.
sessions.description:
The session will be based on an article I published with the same title on medium available on the following link: https://blog.devgenius.io/is-your-website-safe-exploring-vulnerabilities-on-live-websites-6d49d2224942

In this session, rather than using live websites found online, I'll prepare personal target websites the audience can use. The session will focus on understanding security vulnerability of exposing sensitive paths on a website, how a hacker can access and use them, and how to protect websites against such attacks. It will also emphasise on the importance of investing in security as developers or organisations.

sessions.title: Angular Microfrontends with NX and Module Federation
sessions.description:
As products scale we find ourselves needing to provide more autonomy to feature teams to allow them to continue to ship fast. Micro Frontends allow this autonomy.

Using Module Federation with Nx we can improve developer productivity further by providing the best local developer experience for Micro Frontends.

This session will see:
- why Nx and Module Federation provide the best Micro Frontend experience
- how to set up a Micro Frontend architecture with Nx

sessions.title: Kubernetes Bootcamp
sessions.description:
Are you ready to learn Kubernetes, the leading container orchestration platform? Join our Kubernetes Bootcamp and dive deep into containerization, Kubernetes architecture, deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. Through a hands-on lab, you'll gain practical experience with essential tools like kubectl and Helm. This bootcamp is perfect for developers, DevOps engineers, and IT professionals eager to enhance their cloud-native application management skills. By the end, you'll be proficient in deploying, managing, and scaling applications in a Kubernetes environment.

You will also learn about the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) and our local chapter.

Attendees are requested to bring their laptops. However, they are asked to kindly leave their servers at home! Those will be provided "sur-place"!

sessions.title: From Command to Collaborate: Cultivating Team Synergy in Development
sessions.description:
Introduction:
In From Command to Collaborate: Cultivating Team Synergy in Development, I will draw from my 10 years of experience in Germany, where I had the privilege of working with developers from around the world, including Mauritius, Germany, Mexico, and beyond. I'll explore the advantages of leading a multi-cultural team, emphasizing the unique perspectives and strengths diversity brings, while also addressing the challenges faced in fostering effective collaboration.

Main Idea and Subtopics:
I will showcase projects, including collaborations with high-profile clients like on-demand streaming platforms, Pharma, and leading automakers, to illustrate how a shift from a command-oriented approach to a collaborative one has been instrumental in achieving success. 

Conclusion:
In conclusion, this journey 'From Command to Collaborate' highlights the transformative power of fostering team synergy in development. By embracing diversity, encouraging open communication, and valuing collaborative efforts, we not only overcome challenges but unlock the full potential of our teams.

sessions.title: What makes software project management different?
sessions.description:
The five fundamental project management processes around initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure are applicable to managing different projects. 

The requirements and nature of software projects, however, require a unique blend of technical knowledge, adaptability, domain knowledge and people skills to navigate the intricacies of software development. 

In this session, we will explore the practical complexities that software projects involve, and how to navigate through these.

sessions.title: Hugo + GitHub: Create Your Blog!
sessions.description:
Learn how to create a fast and flexible website using Hugo (the star of this show) and host it for free on GitHub Pages (nominated for best supporting actor).

You will also get a taste of CI/CD using GitHub Actions, and we will close off with some neat tricks to keep the costs of keeping the website live at our preferred level (i.e. zero).

Walk out with newly found wisdom on:
- How to install and work with Hugo
- How to apply a theme in your site
- Creating and managing content
- Setting up GitHub Pages
- Deployment using GitHub Actions

If you want to follow along and do some live magic, you will need:
- A GitHub account
- Git installed on your machine
- A text editor of your choice
- A basic understanding of HTML, CSS
- A basic understanding of Markdown

While the technology itself is not overly complex, this session does bring together quite the mixture of concepts to cover.

Bring a fun attitude and a curious mind!

sessions.title: The Frontend Developer Career Path
sessions.description:
In this session i will present a step by step plan of the ideal frontend developer path, how to get started, which things to focus on and which things to avoid. 

This session will be a mix of : 
- advice and best practices
- technical recommendations in terms of frameworks, languages
- hype in the industry
- how to level up
- dealing with interviews

There will be some live coding sprinkled on top as usual to make the session interested, it's devcon after all.

sessions.title: Java or Kotlin. May the Best Bytecode win
sessions.description:
The main inspiration behind Kotlin was to create an alternative to Java that was safer, concise, and expressive. With new feature releases every six months, I suppose Java is catching up. Don't you think so? 

In this talk, we'll compare and contrast the two languages, comparing how they solve developer pain points. From asynchronous programming to nullability and more. 

Do we still need Kotlin? We'll find out in this talk

Spoiler Alert! Maybe Yes

sessions.title: Inside the Mind of a Hacker: Ransomware Attack
sessions.description:
In this session, the audience will gain an understanding of ransomware attacks, learning how to take proactive measures to stay safe, and respond effectively to incidents. Attendees will be equipped with the knowledge and tools to mitigate the risks posed by ransomware and protect their digital assets. They will also understand through a demo session how ransomware are created.


Introduction:
What is Ransomware and How Does it Work?
Impact and Consequences of Ransomware Attacks
Different Types of Ransomware (Encrypting, Locker, Scareware)
Common Ransomware Vectors (Email Attachments, Malicious Links, Exploit Kits)
Notable Ransomware Families (WannaCry, Ryuk, Maze)

The Anatomy of a Ransomware Attack:
Infection Stage (Delivery, Execution, Privilege Escalation)
Encryption Stage (File Encryption, Network Encryption)
Extortion Stage (Ransom Demand, Payment Methods)
Preventing Ransomware Attacks:

Implementing Defense in Depth Strategies
Employee Training and Awareness Programs
Patch Management and Software Updates
Network Segmentation and Access Controls
Email Filtering and Anti-Phishing Measures
Endpoint Security Solutions and Behavior Analysis
Responding to Ransomware Attacks:

Developing an Incident Response Plan
Isolating Infected Systems and Networks
Identifying the Ransomware Variant and Attack Vector
Evaluating Backup and Recovery Options
Engaging with Law Enforcement and Cybersecurity Experts
Considering the Ethical and Legal Implications of Ransom Payments
Case Studies and Real-World Examples:

Notable Ransomware Incidents and Their Impacts
Lessons Learned from Successful and Unsuccessful Responses
Best Practices and Mitigation Strategies Based on Case Studies
Future Trends and Emerging Threats:

The Importance of Proactive Defense and Vigilance
Collaboration and Information Sharing in the Fight Against Ransomware
Building Resilience and Adaptability in the Face of Evolving Threats

Demo session on how ransomware are created.

sessions.title: Dissecting the Digital Deception: Identifying AI-Created Content
sessions.description: “Dissecting the Digital Deception: Identifying AI-Created Content” explores techniques for recognizing content generated by artificial intelligence. This session provides insights and strategies to distinguish between human and AI-authored content, ensuring authenticity in a digitally driven world.

sessions.title: Harnessing Reactivity: Intro to Ember.js
sessions.description: You'll delve into the history and key features of the Ember framework, understanding why it stands out for its superior maintainability and long-term usability, despite not being owned by major corporations like Google or Facebook. Instead, it's backed by industry leaders such as LinkedIn and Heroku. Powerful data management capabilities will be covered with Ember Data, alongside efficient task handling provided by Ember Concurrency. You'll also explore the impressive performance of the Glimmer rendering engine compared to Angular and React, and learn about Ember.js's component-based architecture, which promotes reusable and maintainable code. This session promises to equip you with the knowledge to leverage Ember.js effectively in your web development projects.

sessions.title: Next-Gen Unleashed: Pioneering Integration Excellence with Open Source Empowerment
sessions.description: Discover cutting-edge strategies, real-world insights, and practical applications that define the future of seamless integration. Be part of this transformative experience and unlock the full potential of open source in elevating your integration game.

sessions.title: Zombies and Binary
sessions.description:
Minecraft is played by more than 165 million people. Imagine if just a fraction of those people could learn electrical engineering or computer programming, without even meaning to.

This talk is all about how Minecraft expresses the fundamentals of electronics and programming, and how we can encourage the next generation of electrical engineers and computer programmers in a fun environment.

sessions.title: Supercharge Your Mobile App with Gemini: A Hands-on Guide
sessions.description:
Are you tired of traditional flashcards? Join this session to discover the "Flashcard Genius" concept, an innovative mobile app powered by Gemini, Google's foundation model for mobile apps.

We'll begin with a brief introduction to Gemini, highlighting its capabilities and potential to revolutionize mobile learning experiences. Then, we'll dive into a live demonstration showcasing how you can build a mobile app that incorporates the use of Gemini.

Witness the possibilities of:

Effortless searching: Find flashcards with ease using natural language queries.
Personalized quizzes: Get tested on your weakest areas with AI-generated quizzes.
Interactive learning: Receive insightful feedback, explanations, and alternative perspectives after each answer.
Knowledge consolidation: Generate summaries of key concepts from your flashcards for efficient revision.

This session is a concise, engaging exploration of how AI can transform the way we learn. Whether you're a student seeking a smarter study tool or simply curious about AI's potential, this session will spark your imagination and leave you wanting to learn more.

sessions.title: Why RPA is still relevant in the AI world
sessions.description: Despite all the OpenAI AI advancements in last 14months, ranging from ChatGPT to Sora, RPA (Robotic Process Automaton) is still very much relevant to the large/medium/small enterprises to solve their immediate issues and prepare a level field for the AI mix more impactful in the coming existing time of AI rainbow.

sessions.title: Celery Served Fresh: A Deep Dive into Asynchronous Task Processing with Python Celery
sessions.description:
Join me for a tantalizing exploration into the world of asynchronous task processing with Python Celery in my session titled "Celery Served Fresh." From handling real-time data streams to orchestrating complex workflows, Celery empowers developers to boost application performance and scalability with ease.

Prepare to embark on a journey and learn how to seamlessly integrate Celery into your projects, harnessing its capabilities to tackle even the most demanding workloads with finesse.

Whether you're a seasoned developer seeking to optimize your application's performance or a curious newcomer eager to unlock the potential of asynchronous processing, "Celery Served Fresh" promises to inspire and enlighten.

sessions.title: SUSE Bootcamp — Enterprise Container Management (ECM) and Enterprise Container Security (ECS)
sessions.description:
Enterprise Container Management (ECM)

Embark on the future of container management with SUSE Enterprise Container Management (ECM). Experience streamlined orchestration, enhanced security, and seamless deployment across hybrid cloud environments. Unveil its intuitive interface, advanced automation capabilities, and robust monitoring tools in our technical presentation and live demo showcasing effortless container life-cycle management.

Enterprise Container Security (ECS)

Unlock the pinnacle of container security with SUSE Enterprise Container Security (ECS)! Safeguard your containerized environments with proactive threat detection, comprehensive vulnerability management, and runtime protection. Immerse in our technical presentation, unveiling ECS's cutting-edge features, followed by a live demo showcasing its real-time threat response capabilities.

sessions.title: Digital Twin of an Organization (DTO)
sessions.description:
Transforming Business with Real-time Data and Simulations. 

A Digital Twin of an Organization (DTO) is a dynamic digital model that replicates the entire organization’s operations, processes, and interactions for real-time analysis and optimization.

sessions.title: Integrate Gemini into Your .NET Applications: Unleash the Power of Generative AI
sessions.description:
The world of .NET development just got a whole lot more exciting with the introduction of Gemini, Google's powerful large language model (LLM) API. This talk will guide you through seamlessly integrating Gemini into your .NET applications, unlocking a new level of functionality and creativity.

Working with the Gemini API

- Setting Up Your Project: We'll begin by exploring the steps to set up your .NET project for Gemini access. This includes acquiring the necessary credentials and installing the relevant libraries.
- Interacting with the API: Dive into making API calls to Gemini. We'll cover crafting clear and concise requests, specifying desired outputs, and handling various response formats.
- Processing the Results: Learn how to effectively process Gemini's responses within your application. This includes parsing generated text, interpreting data structures, and integrating the results into your application logic.

Why choosing Gemini?

Gemini offers a diverse range of features:

- Range of specific tasks, such as writing different creative text styles or translating languages.
- Streaming responses which allow fast responsiveness in your applications.
- 1M token to provide context and increase accuracy of responses.
- Multimodal support allowing the combination of text, images and videos for analysis and generation of content.
- Model tuning, which provides the ability to instruct a base model with your data for reality-augmented generation (RAG) and reduction of hallucinations.

Supercharge Your .NET Applications with Gemini

- Boost Developer Productivity: Spend less time on repetitive tasks like code generation or text formatting. Let Gemini handle the heavy lifting!
- Enhance Application Functionality: Integrate features like text summarization, sentiment analysis, or question answering to elevate your application's capabilities.
- Unleash Creative Potential: Generate new ideas, explore different writing styles, or even create prototypes with the help of Gemini's creative text formats.
- Stay at the Forefront of Innovation: Be among the first to leverage cutting-edge generative AI technology in your .NET applications.

Code Examples and Demos

Throughout the talk, we'll showcase practical code examples demonstrating how to integrate Gemini functionalities into your .NET applications. Live demos will further solidify your understanding and ignite your imagination for potential use cases.

Conclusion

Gemini opens a new chapter for .NET development. By integrating this powerful LLM API, you can streamline workflows, unlock creative possibilities, and build smarter, more engaging applications. Take the first step towards the future of .NET development – start integrating Gemini today!

sessions.title: Democratizing AI: Simplifying Solution Development for Non-Technical Users
sessions.description:
In today's rapidly evolving digital landscape, artificial intelligence (AI) has become a transformative force across industries. However, the barrier to entry for non-technical users remains high, limiting their ability to harness the power of AI in their workflows. This session aims to break down those barriers by showcasing how low-code development platforms are democratizing AI, empowering individuals with diverse skill sets to create sophisticated solutions without extensive coding knowledge.

Through a series of practical examples and demonstrations, attendees will explore how low-code platforms streamline the AI development process, from ideation to deployment. By abstracting complex technical details into intuitive visual interfaces, these platforms enable non-technical users to design, train, and deploy AI models with ease. Whether you're a business analyst, marketer, or operations manager, you'll discover how to leverage AI to drive innovation and efficiency in your domain.

Join us as we delve into real-world use cases across various industries, illustrating how non-technical users can leverage low-code AI development platforms to:

- Enhance decision-making processes with predictive analytics
- Using OCR to extract specific text from images or PDFs to automate data processing
- Detect specific objects in images
- Accelerate innovation and stay ahead of the competition in today's data-driven economy.

Whether you're new to AI or looking to expand your skill set, this session offers a practical roadmap for embracing AI-powered solutions without the need for extensive technical expertise. Prepare to unlock the full potential of AI and revolutionize your approach to problem-solving in the digital age.

sessions.title: Web scraping 101 with Python
sessions.description:
This session will highlight the basics of web scraping using python as coding platform. It will include the why, do's and don'ts of web scraping as well as the ethical practices such as respecting the robot.txt. Through a code demo i will explain the different capabilities of browsing static sites through requests library as well as dynamic sites through selenium. Sites will be scraped using dom elements as well as circumventing login pages, etc...
Finally i will showcase the data harvested using a data visualization platform such as PowerBI

sessions.title: En route pour le zéro défaut
sessions.description:
Les défauts coûtent du temps et de l’argent à nos clients et à nos équipes opérationnelles. Ils représentent aussi un coût important pour les équipes techniques aussi bien en terme de temps qu’en terme de stress. Nous avons donc décidé d’adresser le problème de façon volontaire afin d’atteindre un fonctionnement « zéro défaut » du système d’information.

Pour cela, nous activons deux leviers

Un « shift left » général afin de mettre le développeur en capacité de détecter les problèmes et de les résoudre le plus tôt possible dans la chaine.
Une démarche Lean IT et notamment une approche dandotsu pour éliminer les causes racines et engager les équipes dans la gestion des plans de progrès.

Nous partagerons avec vous nos apprentissages et les résultats que nous avons pu obtenir … et ceux que nous recherchons toujours !

sessions.title: Navigating the Ethical Terrain: A Journey into Responsible AI
sessions.description: Join us for a thought-provoking exploration of the Ethics of AI and Responsible AI practices. Delve into the complexities of artificial intelligence ethics, examining the challenges, risks, and opportunities that arise in the rapidly evolving landscape of AI technology. Discover the principles and frameworks guiding ethical AI development and deployment, and gain insights into fostering responsible AI solutions that prioritize fairness, transparency, accountability, and societal well-being. This presentation will empower you with the knowledge and tools to navigate the ethical considerations surrounding AI, ensuring that innovation aligns with human values and respects fundamental rights.

sessions.title: The Art of Infrastructure As Code
sessions.description:
Infrastructure as Code (IaC) is a modern approach in DevOps that involves managing and provisioning technology infrastructure through code instead of manual processes. This method allows for automated, consistent, and efficient setup and maintenance of servers, networks, and other infrastructure elements. Also, It's a key practice in cloud computing, making managing large-scale, complex environments easier

In this presentation, you will learn that every setup is performed similarly, reducing errors and saving time by using Microsoft Bicep and Pulumi. 

Agenda:
1. What is IaC and why it's important?
2. What is Bicep?
3. Pulumi Overview
4. Introduction to Pulumi.
5. Live example: A more complex Azure setup using both tools.
6. Q&A Session

sessions.title: Introduction to Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) with Python
sessions.description: We present the fundamentals of RAG and how it can help overcome the shortcomings of standalone LLMs. A few basic examples of RAG will be presented using Python and LlamaIndex, a framework for LLM applications. It is recommended that attendees have an OpenAI account with credits so that they can implement the examples on their own machine.

sessions.title: Et si on parlait "Qualité Web"
sessions.description: Un site web se doit être efficace et répondre aux exigences des utilisateurs. Comment arriver à ce but ? Heureusement que des normes existent dans ce sens et nous allons justement parler d'un des ces normes, le modèle "VPTCS" .. mais pas que, nous allons aussi présenter la checklist Opquast, une checklist de 240 règles, élaborée pour permettre vérifier/valider que son site convient bien aux normes de qualité du web.

sessions.title: Event driven approach:  Make your app more predictable, maintainable and easier to debug
sessions.description:
MVP, MVVM, MV* are popular architecture design patterns in Android development enabling us to develop smooth and responsive apps. Some time ago I discovered that every time I implemented MVVM, I created a poor man’s state machine. 

In this talk, we’ll see how we can make our apps more predictable, maintainable and easier to debug by integrating state machines into the presentation layer of the app architecture. 

Resources: https://github.com/BKinya/QuickTock
A sample project I implemented using Tinder’s state machine library

Happy Coding!

sessions.title: Making E-Commerce chatbot in Creole
sessions.description:
MRIC Funded project:

We are developing a chatbot to allow Mauritian business to operate their businesses using messaging apps. 

We'll look at the machine learning algorithms and AI used in the project as well the supporting infrastructure.

sessions.title: Achieving Zero downtime Deployment in Banking Applications
sessions.description:
Embark on a journey of insights as the process of implementing zerodowntime deployment in the dynamic realm of banking applications is discussed. With millions of logins daily, substantial challenges were encountered, but commensurate rewards were achieved.

In this session, the adoption of Kubernetes will be explored, playing a pivotal role in the quest for seamless deployment. Experiences will be shared, delving into the hurdles faced, and lessons learned from several failed attempts that ultimately led to success.

Through a real-world case study, the transformative impact on the work-life balance of software engineers and the substantial improvement in customer experience for millions of users will be showcased. The approach taken will be detailed, illustrating how maintenance and bug fixes during peak usage were facilitated, while also elevating overall system resilience.

sessions.title: An overview of Gaming in the Free Libre and Open Source System World
sessions.description:
Basic History of Gaming on Micro-Controllers and Microprocessors to newer hardware and maybe the future.
introduction to Gaming programming on FLOSS. 
Introduction to the Best Gaming Software.

sessions.title: Getting a career in Data Science
sessions.description: An introductory session about data science and it's landscape in mauritius. the different sub-fields in data science and what roles are available in each. what are normally the requirements for each role

sessions.title: Business Critical Linux
sessions.description: Elevate your enterprise with unmatched reliability, scalability, and performance for vital workloads. Enable your business from the datacenter to the edge. Engage in our demo spotlighting SUSE Liberty Linux and Confidential Computing, ensuring utmost security and data privacy for your critical applications.

sessions.title: Introduction to Game Development using Construct 3
sessions.description:
Creating computer games for web and mobile platforms becomes significantly easier using the right tool. In this session, attendees will be able to explore the Construct 3 environment during a unique introductory session on game creation. 
Participants will learn how to create platform-based games like Super Mario, delve into physics-based behaviours for casual games, and have an overview of exporting the game into an Android Mobile Application. 
This session is designed to be interactive; thus, participants are requested to bring their laptops or tablets. Internet access will be needed to use the web platform at https://editor.construct.net. Please note that free access codes to the Construct software will be provided to the first 50 session attendees.

sessions.title: Architects of Data: Unveiling the Role of Data Engineers
sessions.description: Embark on a captivating journey into the world of data engineering with our comprehensive presentation. Discover the pivotal role data engineers play in building robust data pipelines, optimizing data infrastructure, and ensuring the seamless flow of information crucial for data-driven decision-making. From designing scalable architectures to implementing cutting-edge technologies, we'll explore the multifaceted responsibilities of data engineers in harnessing the power of big data. Join us to unravel the intricacies of data engineering and gain valuable insights into the tools, techniques, and best practices driving innovation in this dynamic field. Whether you're a seasoned professional or an aspiring data enthusiast, this session promises to equip you with the knowledge and skills to thrive in the ever-evolving landscape of data engineering.

sessions.title: Exploring the Power of Minimal APIs in .NET 8
sessions.description: Join us for an insightful talk delving into the revolutionary Minimal APIs introduced in .NET 6. In this session, we'll explore how Minimal APIs streamline the process of building lightweight web APIs with minimal ceremony, enabling developers to quickly create efficient and scalable solutions. We'll dive into the key features of .NET 8 and demonstrate how Minimal APIs offer a more concise and expressive way to develop APIs compared to traditional approaches. Whether you're a seasoned .NET developer or new to the ecosystem, this talk will provide valuable insights and practical examples to empower you in leveraging the full potential of Minimal APIs in your projects. Don't miss this opportunity to stay ahead of the curve and elevate your .NET development skills!

sessions.title: Mauritius Internet Exchange Point (MIXP)
sessions.description:
The Mauritius Internet Exchange Point (MIXP) is the first Internet exchange point in Mauritius. It is open to any network operator that believes that they can make their network more efficient through peering.

In this session, the MIXP President will introduce the work of this non-profit organisation, provide statistics on local traffic and give an insight on the work achieved by the technical committee.

sessions.title: The rise of the GAMER 🎮
sessions.description:
I'm excited & honoured to present this year's DEVCONMU conversation under the umbrella of gaming. We welcome a special guest Cedric Sookahet, a local professional gamer with years of experience who will discuss with us the emerging gaming trends both in Mauritius & Internationally. 🕹

Cedric Sookahet started his career as a graphic designer and today is head of digital in a development startup. He has always been a geek at heart and spent his childhood playing Sonic the Hedgehog on the Mega Drive, his early teen years playing strategic games on PC (age of empires, warcraft, starcraft to name a few) and most recently playing Indie games, esport titles and MMORPGs.  In 2019, Cedric founded the first geek platform in Mauritius, Geekin’ Moris, which has now expanded internationally and is known as We are Geekin’. We are Geekin’ is an online media and community, dedicated to sharing gaming, tech and pop culture news. Cedric has had the opportunity to interview and speak to various gaming studio heads and publishers from the US, Canada, Spain and Lithuania.

Please note this will be a recorded session & we'll ensure there is time ample time left for audience questions. Will also have a limited amount of goodies so make sure to stay until the end of the session 🎁

sessions.title: Baby steps into Data Science
sessions.description:
This topic will provide a step by step introduction for those who wish to explore Data Science.
Topics that will be introduced:
1. Linear Regression
2. Logistic Regression
3. How Stats and Probabilities relate to Data Science
4. Machine Learning Fundamentals
5. Natural Language Procession
6. Under the hood with ChatGPT (Neural Network)
7. Generative AI
8. Explainable AI
9. Ethical Data and AI
10. Google Cloud Platform

sessions.title: .NET Diagnostics: Do I feel healthy at the moment?
sessions.description:
Imagine being able to periodically assess the status, availability and performance of your project to output whether it is all operational or if there is a failure. Then, extend that thought from your project to deeper checks on individual nodes and critical services/logic in it. Wouldn't that be wonderful?

There are tools that can help you do that.
But what if it was inbuilt in the project itself, and even provides fallbacks for your project to self-heal if there is a problem?

This session aims to introduce the audience to .NET Health Checks, a nifty little addition to the .NET Framework that can work wonders in diagnostic and monitoring.

Agenda:
- What are health checks and why are they important?
- What are the types and levels of health checks?
- Health Checks middleware and libraries in .NET
- Customizing the health check response
- Resource utilization health checks
- Visualization of health check information

One of the biggest challenges you face when dealing with a customer-focused product is to be as proactive as possible in dealing with production issues. Let's see how close we can get in this session.

sessions.title: Signals – Fine-Grained Reactivity in Angular
sessions.description:
Signals are used to achieve fine-grained reactivity. Seeing its growing popularity, Angular has brought Signals as a new feature to achieve Fine-Grained, Glitch-Free Reactivity.  The signal is a new way to inform the template and another part of the codes that data has changed, and also, it will have more on how Change Detection would be propagated in the component tree. In the future, a Signal component would only cause the Change Detector to run only for the component where data has changed instead of the whole component tree. 

So, what are signals? How would you create, read, and update it? Also, how can a signal and RxJS Observable be used together? This session answers all these questions with a working live coding example.

sessions.title: Godot: Let's make a game in C#
sessions.description: Embark on a captivating journey into game development  on Godot Engine and C#. Designed for both novices and seasoned developers, this session will offer a comprehensive introduction to leveraging the powerful Godot Engine alongside the versatile C# programming language. From setting up the development environment to building a simple game from scratch, attendees will explore essential concepts and practical techniques essential for creating engaging games.

sessions.title: Securing MariaDB: Essentials of Encryption, Protection, and Access
sessions.description: Join us for a concise, impactful session designed for professionals seeking to elevate their MariaDB database security. This session shall cover the essentials of safeguarding your data, including encryption techniques for data at rest, strategies to protect data in transit, and robust access control mechanisms. Whether you're an administrator, developer, or IT security enthusiast, this presentation will arm you with practical insights and actionable steps to fortify your MariaDB databases against threats. Get ready to dive into the world of MariaDB security, demystify complex concepts, and walk away with the knowledge to implement best practices in your organization. Plus, stay engaged for a lively Q&A session where your questions bring depth to the discussion. Secure your spot and empower your database security posture with confidence!

sessions.title: Lightning Talks 2024
sessions.description:
I am to bring back the fun session of Lightning Talks, where each speaker has a very short time frame to present something fun and educational. The session will be accompanied by intro videos for each speaker and we will have a small give away for the audience during the session. Ideally this should be place before the ending ceremony and the goal is to help everyone relax and smile after days of intense technical sessions, while still, learning stuff ! 

# Speakers 

- Houzair Koussa - "Easter eggs in tech"
- Alexandre Bissessur - "Reviving old tech with the Pi Pico"
- Abdallah Yashir Ramsing - AI Innovations in Video Editing: Beyond Imagination
- Jain Ramchurn - "10 bash tricks in 5 minutes"
- Dereck - "The git diffing algorithm"
- Chervine Bhiwoo - "Death by SMS"
- Sandeep Ramgolam - "Learn by building"

sessions.title: Introduction to flutter
sessions.description: An introductory session which will consists of the basics of flutter, some commonly used components and how it makes the app development easy.

sessions.title: Technopreneurship: the next step of many developers?
sessions.description:
There has been a boom in the number of tech startups. Do developers want to be entrepreneurs or do entrepreneurs want a strong technical background?
Guys like Bill Gates have created empires that impact the lives of millions and that will continue long after us. 
Developers are more and more becoming business owners with the same dream as the fathers of Silicon Valley. Mauritians are no different and we are creating some interesting tech as well.
Thinking about this, a lot of questions come into our minds.
All of us have capabilities that allow us to give it a shot. 
In my talk, I will share with you what it takes to get started and our interactive session will definitely see the emergence of people who will be the next case study when talking about this topic.

sessions.title: Build a design system with Android Jetpack Compose
sessions.description:
Background:
Modern applications landscape demands a robust design system to ensure a cohesive and polished user interface. Jetpack Compose, the modern Android UI toolkit, offers a powerful and declarative way to build UIs. By harnessing the capabilities of Jetpack Compose, we can create a design system that not only streamlines the development process but also elevates the overall aesthetic and usability of our applications.  



Objectives:
* 		Consistency: Establish a set of design principles, components, and patterns to ensure visual and functional consistency across our applications.
* 		Efficiency: Leverage the reusability and composability features of Jetpack Compose to accelerate the development process, reducing redundancy and minimizing errors.
* 		Scalability: Design the system with scalability in mind, allowing for easy adaptation to future UI requirements and technological advancements.
* 		Accessibility: Prioritize inclusivity by implementing accessibility best practices within the design system, ensuring our applications are usable by a diverse audience.   


Key Components of the Proposal:

* 		Workshop and Training: Conduct workshops to familiarize our development team with Jetpack Compose, ensuring they have the necessary skills to effectively utilize its capabilities in building the design system.

* 		Design System Definition: Collaborate with design teams to define a comprehensive set of guidelines, components, and patterns that align with our brand identity and user experience goals.
* 		Implementation Roadmap: Develop a phased roadmap for the implementation of the design system, prioritizing key components and ensuring a smooth transition for existing projects.
* 		Documentation: Create detailed documentation for the design system, including guidelines, usage examples, and best practices, to facilitate seamless adoption across development teams.

sessions.title: Securing the Fast Lane: Accelerating SOC Defenses with DevSecOps Magic
sessions.description:
My session is focused on securing the Developer Operations and strategies that can help integrate integrate solid security practices to secure the DevOps pipeline in the context of a SOC environment. 
Here is a breakdown of my session:
- Introduction to DevSecOps and the need for it in a Security Operations Centre (SOC)
- Overview of DevSecOps and the SOC perspective
- Benefits of adding DevSecOps to SOC environments
- Strategies for integrating Security into the DevOps pipeline
- Case Studies and Examples of Shift to DevSecOps
- DevSecOps tools for SOC 
- Collaboration between Security and DevOps Teams
- Challenges faced and Solutions for Effective Implementation
- Continuous Improvement in DevSecOps processes
- Q&A session with attendees
If you are a developer who wants to understand cybersecurity and security monitoring better, then this session is for you. With your code and some best practices around security, we can build better processes to secure our systems and build effective and efficient defense strategies.

sessions.title: Building beautful interfaces with robust ui libraries
sessions.description:
Introduction and Showcase of UI libraries

Demo:
- Set up a project
- Build a page quickly using Tailwind CSS/Daisy/Shadcn
- Explore customization of UI

Join me for an immersive session on creating stunning interfaces with powerful UI libraries.

Learn about the capabilities and advantages of these libraries.

Live demonstrations

Utilize popular libraries like Tailwind CSS, Daisy, and Shadcn to construct visually appealing pages.

Dive deeper into customization options within these libraries.

Let's  craft interfaces that stand out and captivate users.

- Suitable for beginners and experienced developers alike.
- Gain valuable insights and practical techniques for elevating your UI design.

sessions.title: What are the different jobs/roles in a Tech Company
sessions.description:
Are you graduating soon or planning to change career in IT? 

The IT world is not comprised of developers only. There are system admins, DevOps, Project Managers, Quality Assurance and so on. Which career path fits you the best? 

Nayar has over 6 years of experience in the Industry and Startup world. We hope that after this talk, you'll be able to appreciate the work done by other people in your company too.
